channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why banks should leverage AI to serve more than the affluent—and build a financial system for everyone
item.description: Around one billion people still lack access to formal financial systems. AI can help close the gap—in part by allowing for collateral-free lending.

item.title: Trump halts work on an offshore wind project that’s 80% complete, citing unspecified ‘national security interests’
item.description: Revolution Wind was expected to be Rhode Island and Connecticut’s first commercial-scale offshore wind farm, capable of powering more than 350,000 hom...

item.title: We Shouldn’t Be Designing Babies
item.description: Coming off the jeans vs. genes non-scandal, the push for comprehensive embryo screening should make alarm bells go off.

item.title: Texas Gov. Abbott celebrates passage of 'One Big Beautiful' redistricting map
item.description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott vowed to sign the new congressional map after it was approved just hours earlier by the state Senate.

item.title: Texas Gov. Abbott says he'll swiftly sign new maps on his desk that will boost GOP in 2026
item.description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott on Saturday promised to quickly sign off on a new, Republican-leaning congressional voting map gerrymandered to help the GOP ma...

item.title: Trump announces U.S. stake in Intel
item.description: President Trump announced Friday that the government had reached a deal to secure a 10% stake in technology company Intel.

item.title: Conservative activist slams Cracker Barrel; company left reeling after logo redesign
item.description: Conservative activist Robby Starbuck released a scathing critique of Cracker Barrel as the company faces backlash after changing its iconic logo.

item.title: U.S. seeks to deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda after he refused to plea offer in smuggling case

item.title: Rubio's major immigration move praised by conservative experts: 'Long overdue'

item.title: Are College Students Lying About Being Liberal?
item.description: A new study suggests many are simply trying to fit in with the progressive crowd.

item.title: Russia is ‘teetering on the brink of a recession’ and headed for a disastrous harvest, while Putin’s other top source of cash plunges
item.description: "We also think there's a significant probability of Russia's economy slipping into a technical recession in the coming quarters."

item.title: What The Rabbit Club Gets Right
item.description: Despite its somewhat extravagant plot, The Rabbit Club offers what My Oxford Year cannot: an authentic portrayal of Oxford.

item.title: Gianno Caldwell mulls Senate bid as Chicagoans are 'begging for change' on crime woes
item.description: Gianno Caldwell mulls Illinois Senate campaign for Dick Durbin's open seat, focusing on a law-and-order platform after a personal tragedy in Chicago.

item.title: Trump team aims to boot Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda

item.title: A Visit to the Milwaukee Art Museum
item.description: Fabulous building, good art, and an idiotic hit job on American treasures over slavery, equality, and Columbus

item.title: A duty-free exemption is about to expire amid Trump’s trade war. So postal services across Europe will halt shipments to the U.S.
item.description: The exemption, known as the “de minimis" exemption, allows packages worth less than $800 to come into the U.S. duty free.

item.title: The Fed is starting to worry about the housing market now
item.description: "A few participants noted a weakening in housing demand, with increased availability of homes for sale and falling house prices."

item.title: Fulton County Dems Say No One Can Be Forced To Vote — While Forcing GOP To Rubber-Stamp Elections
item.description: 'No one should force an elected official or any voter to cast a particular vote,' Democrat Mo Ivory said.

item.title: Justice Jackson Writes Opinions For Her Media Fanbase, Not Everyday Americans
item.description: The more ill-informed and incoherent Jackson's opinions get, the more fawning coverage the media provides her.
